text: The gem commonly known as chrysoberyl is a yellowish-green, brownish-yellow, or colorless transparent to translucent mineral that is usually faceted into gems and generally considered a collector's stone. While not often set in jewelry, its characteristics make it ideal for such use. Chemically, it is a mixed oxide of beryllium and aluminium. It has the chemical formula . Chrysoberyl is not a type of beryl, which is a beryllium silicate. == Sources == Category:Beryllium minerals Category:Oxide minerals Category:Aluminium minerals
title: Chrysoberyl
